com.example

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Backgammon game implementation. It includes functionality for game setup, player moves, dice rolling, and game state management.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGame

        public static void initializeGame()
        Initializes a new Backgammon game. Sets up the board, prompts for player names, and determines the first player.

      • playGame

        public static void playGame()
        Manages the main game loop, handling player turns and commands.

      • displayPipCount

        public static void displayPipCount()
        Displays the current pip count for both players.

      • calculatePipCount

        public static int calculatePipCount(boolean forPlayer1)
        Calculates the pip count for a given player.
        Parameters:
        forPlayer1 - true if calculating for player 1, false for player 2
        Returns:
        the calculated pip count

      • displayMatchInfo

        public static void displayMatchInfo()

      • handleDoubleCommand

        public static void handleDoubleCommand()
        Handles the doubling cube command. Offers a double to the opponent and processes their response.

      • handleDiceCommand

        public static void handleDiceCommand(java.lang.String[] parts)
        Sets custom dice values for the next roll.
        Parameters:
        parts - An array containing the command and two dice values

      • handleTestCommand

        public static void handleTestCommand(java.lang.String[] parts)
        Executes commands from a specified file for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        parts - An array containing the command and filename

      • processCommand

        public static void processCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Processes a single command, used for both user input and test file commands.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to process

      • endGame

        public static void endGame(boolean forfeit)
        Ends the current game, updates scores, and checks for match completion.
        Parameters:
        forfeit - true if the game ended due to a forfeit, false otherwise

      • calculatePoints

        public static int calculatePoints()
        Calculates the points for the current game, including Gammon and Backgammon.
        Returns:
        the calculated points

      • isGamemon

        public static boolean isGamemon()
        Checks if the current game state is a Gammon.
        Returns:
        true if the game is a Gammon, false otherwise

      • isBackgammon

        public static boolean isBackgammon()
        Checks if the current game state is a Backgammon.
        Returns:
        true if the game is a Backgammon, false otherwise

        public static boolean hasCheckersInHomeBoard(boolean forPlayer1)
        Checks if a player has checkers in their home board.
        Parameters:
        forPlayer1 - true to check for player 1, false for player 2
        Returns:
        true if the player has checkers in their home board, false otherwise

                                 int die)

        Parameters:
        fromPoint - The point to bear off from
        die - The die roll value
        Returns:
        true if bearing off is legal, false otherwise

      • highestOccupiedPoint

        public static int highestOccupiedPoint(boolean forPlayer1)
        Finds the highest occupied point for a player.
        Parameters:
        forPlayer1 - true for player 1, false for player 2
        Returns:
        The highest occupied point, or -1 if no points are occupied
